import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom'; import axios from 'axios'; import Header from "./header/header"; import Footer from "./footer/footer"; const PackageDetail = () => { const [packageDetails, setPackageDetails] = useState(null); const { id } = useParams(); // This id should correspond to the package's identifier useEffect(() => { if (id) { axios.get(`${process.env.REACT_APP_API_URL}/packages/${id}`) .then(response => { // Assuming the API returns the package detail object directly if (response.data && Object.keys(response.data).length > 0) { setPackageDetails(response.data); } else { console.error('Package data is empty:', response.data); // Consider updating the state to display a 'not found' message } }) .catch(error => { console.error('Error fetching package details:', error); // Handle the error state here, possibly updating the state to inform the user }); } }, [id]); if (!packageDetails) { return
Loading...
; } // Ensure that imageUrl is correct. For example, if your server stores the full URL, you may not need to prepend REACT_APP_UPLOAD_API_URL const imageUrl = `${process.env.REACT_APP_UPLOAD_API_URL}/${packageDetails.imageUrl}`; // Ensure these fields are spelled correctly and match the database schema const { packageName, packageDurationDate, packageLocation, packageDescription, amenitiesInHotel, agentName, packagePrice, packageDate } = packageDetails; return ( <>
{packageDetails ? ( <>

) : (
Loading or no package found...
)}
); }; export default PackageDetail;
